com.camerontec.catalys.mis.eps.escalationpaths.runtime.actions

Class BaseSNMPAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.mis.eps.escalationpaths.runtime.actions.AbstractAction
      • com.camerontec.catalys.mis.eps.escalationpaths.runtime.actions.BaseSNMPAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAction, com.camerontec.catalys.mis.eps.IPersistable, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SampleSNMPAction

    public abstract class BaseSNMPAction
extends AbstractAction
    Base abstract superclass for actions that consist in sending an SNMP trap. The implementation uses SNMP4J for sending traps. The following configuration properties are supported:
    • SNMP version: 1 or 2c
    • Target host (localhost by default)
    • Target port (162 by default)
    • Target community name ("public" by default)
    • SNMP agent's host address
    • Delivery timeout
    • Number of delivery retries
    Concrete subclasses are expected to provide an implementation for one or both of methods populateV1PDU(PDUv1, IEvent) and populateV2PDU(PDU, IEvent). When the action is executed, depending on which SNMP version was configured, the corresponding method is invoked to populate the trap's PDU with variable bindings coming from the event that caused the execution of this action. How this is implemented depends on the SNMP MIB in use. For a working example, see class SampleSNMPAction and its associated MIB.

      • getSupportedPropertyNames

        public Set<String> getSupportedPropertyNames()
        Description copied from interface: IAction
        Must return all the supported property names for the action. If any of the properties contains a property that is not in the list of supported properties, the action will fail to initialise.
        Returns:
        Set of all the supported property names

      • getMandatoryPropertyNames

        public Set<String> getMandatoryPropertyNames()
        Description copied from interface: IAction
        Must return a list of all the mandatory property names for the action, without which the configuration of the action must fail.
        Returns:
        Set of all the mandatory property names

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Description copied from interface: IAction
        Performs the necessary initialization of this action. This may involve validating the action's properties, allocating resources, etc. Any exception thrown by the implementation of this method will cause the MIS to refuse to start This will always be invoked before IAction.executeAction(ActionSourceEvent).
